title: Facebook's Care Reaction: Everything You Need to Know

steps.title: The Care reaction represents a virtual hug.
steps.content: The Care reaction represents a virtual hug. This Facebook reaction first appeared in late April 2020 in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. Facebook stated that they hoped the reaction would help people feel “a bit more connected” to family and friends. You may see someone use the Care reaction to respond to posts about the pandemic or feelings of isolation.

steps.title: The Care reaction shows support.
steps.content: The Care reaction shows support. Facebook launched this reaction as a way for users to express empathy, kindness, and understanding. The Care reaction goes beyond the classic heart reaction, embodying the warmth of a hug. [1] X Trustworthy Source Greater Good Magazine Journal published by UC Berkeley's Greater Good Science Center, which uses scientific research to promote happier living Go to source People often use this reaction in solidarity or to say, “I’m here for you.”

steps.title: The Care reaction expresses compassion.
steps.content: The Care reaction expresses compassion. If someone reacts to your Facebook post with this emoji, they’re sending all the good vibes your way. The Care reaction is a friendly, caring, and concerned response—a way to say, “I love you” and “I care about you” all at once. You might notice people using this reaction in response to posts about self-doubt, losing a loved one, or natural disasters.

steps.title: When you’re sending a virtual hug.
steps.content: When you’re sending a virtual hug. Everyone needs a hug every now and then! If a friend posts a status update that would have you hugging them in real life, react with a Care reaction. This is a great way to show your support, love, and compassion for whatever they’re going through. [2] X Research source

steps.title: When you want to show compassion.
steps.content: When you want to show compassion . Respond to a post with a Care reaction to say, “I care about you.” Perhaps a friend or family member has posted something vulnerable and you don’t know exactly what to say. Tapping that Care reaction is a loving and comforting way to send good vibes and tell them you’re here for them. [3] X Trustworthy Source Mental Health Foundation UK charity working towards good mental health for all. Go to source

steps.title: When someone’s anxious.
steps.content: When someone’s anxious . Send all your love and support to a friend mentally struggling. Maybe they post an update about not feeling well, losing their job, or just trying to stay afloat. You can react to their post with a Care reaction to say, “I’m here for you. You’re not alone.” The Care reaction can send a little bit of warmth their way. [4] X Trustworthy Source Johns Hopkins Medicine Official resource database of the world-leading Johns Hopkins Hospital Go to source

steps.title: When someone’s had a bad day.
steps.content: When someone’s had a bad day. It happens. We all have bad days every once and a while, and the Care reaction is a perfect way to send a virtual hug. If a friend or family member posts an update describing their no good very bad day, react with a Care reaction to say, “Sending hugs!” [5] X Research source

steps.title: When someone’s grieving
steps.content: When someone’s grieving . Sometimes a comment isn’t enough to express your condolences. A Care reaction is a great way to send a virtual hug and offer a shoulder to cry on. You’re showing your support, love, and compassion all with one simple reaction. [6] X Trustworthy Source Mind U.K.-based mental health charity focused on providing advice and resources to anyone facing mental health problems. Go to source

steps.title: The Care reaction is a smile emoji hugging a heart.
steps.content: The Care reaction is a smile emoji hugging a heart. When scrolling through your Facebook feed , you may find a post from someone that may need a little boost. [7] X Trustworthy Source Science Direct Online archive of peer-reviewed research on scientific, technical and medical topics Go to source To send the Care reaction, navigate to the post. Tap or click and hold the Like button. A row of reactions will pop up. Tap or click the emoji hugging a heart to send the Care reaction.

steps.title: Try out the 6 other reactions on Facebook.
steps.content: Try out the 6 other reactions on Facebook . The Care reaction came in April 2020, but 6 other reactions were introduced in 2015. [8] X Research source With 7 emoji reactions on every post, you can react in whatever way you’d like! Check out the meanings of Facebook’s OG reactions to see what to click to laugh out loud or cry at a friend’s recent post: 👍 (Like): “Yeah, this is cool.” ❤️ (Love): “I LOVE IT!” or “I LOVE YOU!” 😂 (Haha): “This is hilarious!” 😯 (Wow): “Wow! I can’t believe it!” 😢 (Sad): “This is so sad,” or “I’m crying!” 😡 (Angry): “My blood is boiling.” These examples are using Unicode standard emojis. Facebook’s emoji reactions will look a bit different.
